TopicTitle: ASET Avionics Pack v 2.1 (for the modders who create IVA)

Articles.Content: **This pack is for the modders who create IVA's for the aircrafts** > > ![RTxro1yl.png](http://i.imgur.com/RTxro1yl.png) > > [view imgur album](http://imgur.com/a/RfEes) Some time ago I received a request from the user MasseFlieger to make a couple of aircraft instruments for his [projects](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/96148-AeroKerbin-Industries-Modified-IVAs). I love aviation, I fly in MFSX and DCS so I decided to do them. But I didn't just made only ones that what requested - instead I made a whole pack of classic analog props for the planes. - Altitude indicator (ASL) - Radio Altimeter - Air Speed Indicator (EAS) - Mach Number gauge - Vertical Speed Indicator - Heading gauge - Turn Coordinator - Dynamic Pressure gauge - **Temperature gauges (Engine, Skin, Internal, Enviroment and Surface)** - Ground Speed Indicator - Artificial Horizon Indicator - **RMI** - **HSI** - **Navigation Radio Units** - **Comm RAdio Unit** - **DME Unit** - **AoA gauge** - Trim Indicator - Throttle/Thrust gauge - G-meter - Compass - Battery charge gauge - **Fuel/Air Flow gauge** - Fuel Quantity gauge - Flaps setting indicator - Gear Lever - **Brake Force gauge** - **Engine mode toggle switch** - **Engine Reverce toggle switch** - **GPS Display** - **Power Supply Display** - Flaps control lever (FAR) - Spoilers lever (FAR) - Yoke - Heads-Up Display - **"Boeing"-style Toggle and Rotary switches** You can download and install this mod to see all these devices in action **If you want me to make any other instrument write me in this thread.** **Jebbesen**® **Kerbin Aerocharts** [![mPTxY3cm.png](http://i.imgur.com/mPTxY3cm.png)](https://www.dropbox.com/s/mh2k85ryrtarqci/Kerbin_AEROCHARTS-25-nov-2017.pdf?dl=0) (clickable) ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Attention all IVA-makers, who created there own props based on the ASET props.** **In the next major version of ASET PROPS old tumblers and buttons will be removed.** **All IVA makers are advised to switch to new, modular buttons.** ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **mods dependency** **required:** [Module Manager 2.8+](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/50533-121-module-manager-275-november-29th-2016-better-late-than-never/) [RasterPropMonitor v0.30.2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/105821-122-rasterpropmonitor-still-putting-the-a-in-iva-v0280-21-december-2016/) [ASET_Props v 1.5+](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116430-ivaprops-aset-props-pack-v13-for-the-modders-who-create-iva/) **recommended:** ~~[FAR v 0.16.7.2+](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/19321-113-ferram-aerospace-research-v01572-lanchester-7116/)~~ ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Downloads:** [ASET Avionics Pack v 2.1](https://spacedock.info/mod/1213/ASET%20Avionics) **(Spacedock)** ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Installation:** - Install into “***/Gamedata/ASET/"*** ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Known issues:** - DME unit uses the flat map model to calculate the distances, due to which the calculations might be incorrect especially closer to the poles. The issue will be resolved with the release of "[MAS](https://github.com/MOARdV/AvionicsSystems)". ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Spy<](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/158770-the-amazing-spy/) Special thanks to [@MOARdV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/60950-moardv/), [@Mihara](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/59752-mihara/), [@DennyTX](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/92389-dennytx/) , [@nukeboyt](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/68397-nukeboyt/) , [@Dragon01](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/17022-dragon01/) and [@linuxgurugamer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129964-linuxgurugamer/) for their help and support with the mods development. And all the forum users who support and motivate me to keep working on my mods. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Like what I do? Want to directly support development? Consider donating via Patreon or Paypal!** **** [![QcYfNA1.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/QcYfNA1.png?1)](https://www.patreon.com/alexustas) **** [![btn_donate_LG.gif](https://www.paypalobjects.com/en_US/i/btn/btn_donate_LG.gif)](https://www.paypal.me/alexustasASET) ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ![88x31.png](http://i.creativecommons.org/l/by-nc-sa/3.0/88x31.png) ### 'ASET Avionics' by Alexustas is licensed under a [Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.](http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/) ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Changelog: 26/11/2017 ASET avionics - V 2.1 *Optimization and various improvements *Fixed an error in Aero Charts thanks to lazr2222 and MOARdv. 09/02-2017 ASET avionics - V 2.0 What is changed: Almost all props were rebuilt due to the migration to Unity5, and also for the possibility to use new RPM features most props now support the "COLOR_OVERRIDE" feature, which give all IVA-makers ample opportunity to customize their own IVA the switches "ASET_B-Knob" are now modular, you can combine the switch model, the collider model and label using the MODEL{} module to create your variations of this prop. 2 to 6 positions of the switch are supported. What’s new: *full set of the analog indicators (gauges) for temperature is added *analog indicators (gauge) for the brakes force is added *full set of the analog indicators (gauges) for the engine is added: -air flow -fuel flow -engine mode (primary / secondary) -throttle-limit -the new design of throttle/thrust indicator *the new design of the vertical speed indicator *the new design of the heading indicator *LCD-display for the estimated time of the flight and distance *LCD-display for the GPS coordinates *toggle-switches for the engine's reverse control, engine's mode control, fuel cells and emergency power generator control *a fully functional system of radio navigation, which includes: -realistic RMI and HSI indicators, which support NDB, VOR and ILS -two NAV-radio units -DME unit -network of Nav facilities covering the surface of Kerbin -ILS complex for the KSC airfield -Kerbin Aerocharts **Edited May 17, 2018 by alexustas**

This is . . .

Simply wow.

Just blows my mind.

Personally, I have a strong preference for MFDs, but all of those bells and whistles still look fantastic. Might you actually integrate props for BD Armory systems? There's a number of things that are supposedly in the pipeline for the next patch of that mod, namely involved in detection and counter-detection. Having MFDs that work with them, or not so mf displays, would be really cool.

> 
> ... Might you actually integrate props for BD Armory systems? ...

**I CAN:**

make the props for the A10C instruments, such as: Countermeasure Set Control (CMSC) and the ALR-69 (v) Radar Warning Receiver (RWR). add the information related to arms for HUD, to make a "military" version of the MFD, including the page "Targeting Pod (TGP)" and "Digital Stores Management System (DSMS)". also, can do a "Targeting Pod" part for placing it on the standard place.

![61wtI0Bm.png](http://i.imgur.com/61wtI0Bm.png)![qpiX0ZLm.png](http://i.imgur.com/qpiX0ZLm.png)![6tOSBYCm.png](http://i.imgur.com/6tOSBYCm.png)

![66s9z1km.png](http://i.imgur.com/66s9z1km.png)![rRChGVNm.png](http://i.imgur.com/rRChGVNm.png)![yXyJHMCm.png](http://i.imgur.com/yXyJHMCm.png)

![aaq28_01.jpg](http://rightwing.sakura.ne.jp/equipment/usa/usaf/aaq28/aaq28_01.jpg)

**I CAN NOT:**

make it work. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

it requires a plug-bridge between the Armory and the RPM , which will provide a complete set of data for managing all these devices. And I'm not a programmer.

Alex, you've made a couple of requests for RPM features. Now I'm going to make a couple of requests for ASET features. That's fair, right? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

1: Generic linear analog gauge:

[![UVQpdI.png](http://imagizer.imageshack.us/v2/640x480q90/661/UVQpdI.png)](https://imageshack.com/i/idUVQpdIp)

Simply a percentage scale with an analog bar or arrow that is animated (can be used for throttle %, fuel %, and so forth). With backlighting like the other analog avionics gauges, of course.

2: Generic jeweled lamp:

[![zsYNNw.jpg](http://imagizer.imageshack.us/v2/640x480q90/661/zsYNNw.jpg)](https://imageshack.com/i/idzsYNNwj)

The lights from your switch w/guard are good examples (just with no switch and no descriptor plate). All I want is a simple domed lamp that I can control (turn on / turn off / color change) using JSIVariableAnimator.

3: The complex one:

[![Q63uXG.jpg](http://imagizer.imageshack.us/v2/640x480q90/673/Q63uXG.jpg)](https://imageshack.com/i/ipQ63uXGj)

The range and range-rate instrument from Gemini (used for docking). What I'd really like is the outer scale to be in meters x 1000, and linear (this looks logarithmic) out to 10km maybe? The inner ring scale could be range from -100 to +1000m - maybe it would make more sense as a logarithmic scale (if that's not too hard). The rate would make sense as +/- 2m/s (maybe that's accurate enough for docking). All three gauges would be controlled by JSIVariableAnimator, of course.

EDIT: I found the documentation for this instrument in the Gemini manual (volume 2) - the outer ring is used to report distance. The inner ring reports the relative speed (closure rate). It's actually a fairly interesting device, but I'll skip the details. Maybe rescale the outer ring to 0 - 10 ( x1000 meters), and have an inner ring that corresponds to 0 - 100 (m/s). The inner gauge (the -5 - +5 ft/s) is longitudinal rate, so it could remain as a -2 - +2 m/s - the documentation says it's pegged to one of the extremes up until the final approach for docking. Although having a 2nd gauge like that (maybe pointing to the left, or on the left edge pointing inwards, so it's oriented vertically) would allow decomposing longitudinal motion into vertical and horizontal components.

I'd be happy with the first two items. I'd be extremely happy if the docking gauge was possible, too, but I realize that's more complex and specialized. I'm still trying to think of analog gauges that could work for docking alignment, but I haven't come up with anything yet.

Argh.

After reading this fine posting (I use rasterpropmonitor-ASET-based avionics command pods whenever I can...I am so addicted to the 'in-pod' gameplay), it looks like I will have to scratch the surface, try to learn some of this stuff, and try my hand at bringing the NearFuture 7 man command pod into an Rasterprop/ASET iva.

I would rather someone else do it that has the skills and expertise, but alas, I believe Nertea has enough on his hands already.

Cheers.

> 
> Argh.
> After reading this fine posting (I use rasterpropmonitor-ASET-based avionics command pods whenever I can...I am so addicted to the 'in-pod' gameplay), it looks like I will have to scratch the surface, try to learn some of this stuff, and try my hand at bringing the NearFuture 7 man command pod into an Rasterprop/ASET iva.
> 
> I would rather someone else do it that has the skills and expertise, but alas, I believe Nertea has enough on his hands already.
> 
> Cheers.

I'd encourage you to try your hand at it. It's not too hard to do, if you're using the props included in ASET Avionics, ASET Props, and stock RPM. You have to install a Unity editor and KSP Part Tools, and then it's mostly a case of placing props, resizing them, and moving them around. It is time consuming, however. For instance, this:

[![5Jq35p.jpg](http://imagizer.imageshack.us/v2/640x480q90/661/5Jq35p.jpg)](https://imageshack.com/i/id5Jq35pj)

is about 10 - 15 hours of work (between arranging things in Unity, testing it in-game, and customizing some prop configurations). I've put about 15 - 20 more hours into it and rearranged a lot of things since then. I can't imagine how much time Alexustas has put in to the pods he's done (although maybe, being artistically inclined, he's quicker at it than I am).

Thanks for the advice and the encouragement MOARdV. You folks are the movers and shakers of KSP, so it's probably time for me to get my hands dirty and do lots of trial and error (oh, and I will watch those youtube videos mentioned on the previous page, especially part III).

Cheers....I will have my 7 man command module with a decent IVA one of these days ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).
